content.title: Intravascular Lithotripsy (IVL)
content.definition: Endovascular technique using sonic pressure waves to fracture circumferential and deep calcium within the arterial wall, facilitating vessel expansion without the limitations of traditional calcified plaque treatment.

mechanism.energy: Sonic pressure waves propagated through vessel
mechanism.effect: Fractures both intimal and medial calcium
mechanism.advantage: Works on deep/medial calcium that atherectomy cannot reach

advantages_over_atherectomy: Works through vessel wall, not just lumen
limitations: Requires balloon contact with vessel wall
